articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits Fishery Station in Kumya
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits Fishery Station in Kumya
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to the Wonphyong Taehung Fishery Station in Kumya County, South Hamgyong Province.
					 He dropped in at the room devoted to the history of the station to be briefed on the course of its development. Then he went round a processing shop and other production processes and varieties of processed marine products to acquaint himself in detail with the technical equipment and production at the station.
					
					 He praised its workers for having done a lot of work to increase the production capacity, including construction of wharf, with their own efforts by fully displaying the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance.
					
					 Learning about the freshness of various aquatic products turned out by the station, he gave a high appreciation of the great efforts made by its officials, workers and technicians to provide much more fresh fish and processed fish to the people in all seasons.
					
					 It is of weighty significance in further strengthening the nation's economic might and improving the material welfare of the people to rapidly develop the fisheries by exploiting and using the aquatic resources in our country sea-bound on three sides, he said.
					
					 Stressing the importance to strictly implement the WPK's policy of simultaneously carrying on large-scale fisheries and small- and medium-scale fisheries and thus decisively increase the volume of fish production, he indicated the orientation and ways to do so.
					
					 He said that in order to conduct fishing operations as required by changed fishing conditions, it is necessary to thoroughly establish a scientific fishing system and widely introduce advanced fishing tackle and methods and, at the same time, carry on the work for exploring new fishing grounds under a long-term plan.
					
					 Enough modern freezing facilities are needed to supply fresh fish to the people while increasing the haul of varieties of fish, he said.
					
					 He noted that the powerful heavy industry our people built up with much effort, pulling in their belt, has began to exert its tremendous potentials, making a decisive breach for the rapid development of light industry, agriculture, fisheries and other fields directly related to the people's living. And he earnestly called upon all the fishery enterprises to effect great changes and successfully carry into practice the WPK's intention to bring about a radical turn in the people's standard of living this year marking its 65th birthday, thus making positive contributions to opening the gate to a thriving nation.
					
					 Accompanying him were Department Director Kim Kyong Hui and First Vice Department Directors Ri Je Gang, Ri Jae Il, Jon Il Chun and Han Kwang Sang of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets Vietnam Communist Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Greets Vietnam Communist Party Leader
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Nong Duc Manh, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of its founding.
					 The message said:
					
					  I extend warm congratulations to you and, through you, to the C.C., the Communist Party of Vietnam, all its members and the people of Vietnam on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the founding of the CPV.
					
					 The founding of the CPV was a historic event that brought about a radical turn in carving out the destiny of the Vietnamese people.
					
					 The CPV has organized and led the struggle of the Vietnamese people for national independence and the country's reunification and socialism to victory while overcoming all sorts of trials and hardships for a long period.
					
					 We are pleased with the fact that the Vietnamese people have made great successes in the struggle to build rich and powerful and prosperous Vietnam true to the behests of President Ho Chi Minh under the leadership of the CPV with you as general secretary.
					
					 Our meeting in 2007 marked an important occasion that put strong spurs to the development of the friendly relations between the two parties and the two countries. 
					
					 Convinced that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and peoples of the two countries will grow stronger, I sincerely wish your party greater success in the struggle for the victory of the socialist cause.

articles.title: Inter-Korean Working Contact for KIZ Held
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Working Contact for KIZ Held
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- An inter-Korean working contact for operations in the Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ) took place in Kaesong on Monday.
					 At the contact the north side proposed discussing, first of all, its workers' wage hike and rent for land. But the south side insisted on the preferential solution of the issues of passage, customs clearance and communications, sidestepping the north side's principled and just proposal. It deliberately created a hurdle in the way of discussion, taking issue with the routine military drill conducted by the Korean People's Army with a hue and cry over "escalation of tension" and somebody's "uneasiness." 
					
					 The north side sternly denounced the south side for kicking up a racket of confrontation with the DPRK over the KPA's artillery firing drill, driving the inter-Korean relations to the phase of confrontation.
					
					 The north side emphasized that if the south side has a true intention to settle the above-said three issues in the KIZ, it should respond to the north-proposed military working-level talks as early as possible and take a proper stand on the wage hike.
					
					 It made it clear that an early increase of wages of workers from the north side, in particular, constitutes a key and urgent issue related not only to the operations in the KIZ but to its prospect. 
					
					 The north side chided the south side for making empty talks, persistently insisting on the secondary issues raised by it at the previous contact without having any preparation and study, and urged it to honestly respond to the discussion on the north-proposed realistic issues. 
					
					 Both sides agreed to discuss the issues of construction of workers' lodging quarters and their wage hike, etc. at the future working contact and handle the issues of passage, customs clearance and communications in the KIZ at the inter-Korean military working-level talks.

articles.title: Officials Paid Farewell by Chinese Ambassador
articles.content:
Officials Paid Farewell by Chinese Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kim Yong Il together with Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol met and conversed with Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on them, at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					 Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, also met and had a talk with Liu Xiaoming at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on the same day.

articles.title: Gift from Peruvian Figure
articles.content:
Gift from Peruvian Figure
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the secretary general of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on the occasion of his birthday.
					The gift was handed to an official of the DPRK embassy in Lima by Secretary General Yuri Castro Romero on Jan. 29.

articles.title: Kimjongilia Festival Poster Produced
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Festival Poster Produced
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A poster of the 14th Kimjongilia Festival, to be opened to mark the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, has been produced.
					 Depicted in the center of the poster is immortal Kimjongilia in full bloom against the background of Jong Il Peak.
					
					 Seen in its upper part are letters "Celebration of February 16" and the emblem of the festival and in its lower part letters reading "The 14th Kimjongilia Festival" and the venue and period of the festival.

articles.title: Birthday Stamps Issued
articles.content:
Birthday Stamps Issued
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Four kinds of individual stamps have been brought out in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea with the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il approaching. 
					 Portrayed in the stamps, each with letters "February 16" in upper part, are Paeonia suffruticosa, Bougainvillea glabra cv. Sanderiana and other rare plants sent to Kim Jong Il from other countries as gifts.
					
					 The plants are growing in different parts of Korea.

articles.title: Children's Films Released
articles.content:
Children's Films Released 
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Korean April 26 Children's Film Studio has of late released new films.
					 "A Story about Three Brothers" is based on a folktale told by President Kim Il Sung. When a fire broke out in a mountain, the eldest one who built up his body at a smithy and the second who studied at a village school didn't know how to put it out but the youngest who learned from peasants did it. Through this story the film shows that one should cultivate wisdom and strength applicable to practice. 
					
					 "Let's Keep Rule without Fail" gives common knowledge needed for children to preserve their health, while "In Car Park", ninth part of "Let's Observe Traffic Regulations", gives a lesson to children in avoiding traffic accidents.

articles.title: Earliest Possible Conclusion of Peace Treaty Called for
articles.content:
Earliest Possible Conclusion of Peace Treaty Called for
						
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- If another war breaks out on the Korean Peninsula, its catastrophic consequences will be incomparable with those of the last Korean war in the past century. The most realistic way of preventing such horrible disasters from taking place is to replace the outdated Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty as soon as possible for the purpose of establishing a lasting peace-keeping regime on the peninsula.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 If the AA is replaced with a peace treaty, it will be possible to defuse the military confrontation on the peninsula and automatically settle the issue of building confidence between the DPRK and the U.S. and, furthermore, create an atmosphere of peace in the Asia-Pacific.
					
					 There is no ground whatsoever for the U.S. to refuse to respond to the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty as the former clarified more than once that it "had no intention to invade" the DPRK and expressed its readiness to build a peace-keeping regime on the peninsula.
					
					 If the U.S. truly opts for settling the issue of the Korean Peninsula, the conclusion of a peace treaty will not pose any problem and the process for the denuclearization of the peninsula will make rapid progress.
					
					 The issue of concluding a peace treaty will find a smooth solution if the U.S. properly judges the changed situation and the trend of historic development and makes a bold switchover in its DPRK policy in line with its interests and the aspiration of the world peace-loving people. 
					
					 The conclusion of a peace treaty is not an issue of one party bringing a benefit to the other party or that party giving a reward for it but a practicable political issue beneficial to the parties concerned including the DPRK and the U.S. and the international community and conducive to ensuring the world peace.
					
					 The U.S. should honestly respond to the DPRK's proposal. The U.S. would be well advised not to play a double game but follow the world people's mindset.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Switch Anti-North Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Switch Anti-North Policy
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities should take a bold option to repeal such anti-reunification fascist laws as the "National Security Law" and make a switchover in their anachronistic "policy towards the north" if they truly wish to see the improved inter-Korean relations. Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 There are in south Korea still legal and institutional mechanisms including the NSL which incriminate and bar the inter-Korean travels, contacts and discussions on reunification. 
					
					 It is an unreasonable and anachronistic act for the south Korean authorities to incriminate and suppress the just activities of people for reunification, persistently keeping such leftovers of the old era of confrontation as the NSL. It is as clear as noonday that inter-Korean relations cannot be put on a normal track nor can national reconciliation and cooperation be successfully achieved so long as the fascist law which bans people's patriotic actions for reunification remains in force in south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' policy of anti-reunification confrontation is another obstacle to achieving national reconciliation and cooperation and improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					  It is nonsensical for the south Korean authorities to talk about "reconciliation" and "improved relations" while keeping the above-mentioned legal and institutional mechanisms in force.
					
					 It is impossible to rid the inter-Korean relations of their catastrophe as long as hurdles are lying in the way of national reconciliation and cooperation. There will be a landmark phase favorable for improving the inter-Korean relations and achieving national reunification when the NSL is repealed to guarantee the freedom of the reunification movement in south Korea and replace the policy of anti-reunification confrontation with a policy of alliance with the north and reconciliation.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Japan should drop its foolish bid to evade the responsibility for settling its past crimes and make a bold decision to liquidate the crime-woven history as demanded by the international community.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday urges this in a signed commentary.
					
					 The commentary recalls that Germany has consistently paid reparation for the last several decades on the basis of its honest reflection on the gravity of the crimes it committed in the past.
					
					 It is regrettable, indeed, that only Japan is blatantly challenging the just demand of the international community for the settlement of its past crimes, without showing even the slightest sign of redeeming its past wrongs in the international arena at present, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Japanese ultra right-wing reactionaries are whitewashing the criminal wars of aggression fought by Japan as "just wars" for "protecting" and "liberating" other Asian countries from the Western powers. They stooped to such an infamy as describing the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, the worst tragedy in the 20th century, as deeds perpetrated by individual non-governmental businessmen and voluntary commercial wrongdoing by prostitutes.
					
					 Abe and other Japanese psychopaths are leaving no means untried to evade the responsibility for redeeming Japan's past crimes including the above-said sexual slavery at any cost, asserting there is no evidence enough to prove them.
					
					 It cannot but be a shame on the international community that there still exist in the world such betes noires bereft of even an iota of human conscience and morality. 
					
					 It should bring them to the tribunal of justice and mete out a stern judgment to them.

articles.title: WPK's Songun Revolutionary Exploits Lauded
articles.content:
WPK's Songun Revolutionary Exploits Lauded
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Songun revolutionary leadership exploits performed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il serve as the most valuable treasure of Kim Il Sung's nation and a great banner firmly guaranteeing the final victory of the drive for building a thriving nation and the cause of Juche, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in an editorial.
					 The Workers' Party of Korea's Songun leadership exploits serve as an ever-victorious banner which helps demonstrate the sovereign dignity and invincible might of the country, a valuable treasure which helps immensely reinforce the single-minded unity of the service personnel and people around the headquarters of the revolution and a treasured sword for bringing about a leap forward, which helps effect great innovations on all fronts for building a thriving nation by giving free rein to their mental power, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 Thanks to the powerful military capability for self-defense built up under the banner of Songun, the DPRK is now firmly maintaining its independent stand, remaining undeterred by any formidable enemy's threat of aggression, and carrying on its revolution and construction its own way, guided by its ideology and faith. 
					
					 The DPRK is shedding its rays as an invincible political and ideological power and as a country which boasts single-minded unity. This is a noble fruition of Kim Jong Il's unique Songun revolutionary leadership as he has wisely led the efforts to train the revolutionary ranks of the DPRK with the Korean People's Army as the core into elite ones.
					
					 The whole country is now alive with the dynamic advance for a leap forward towards a thriving nation. The high-pitched drive for a great revolutionary surge is giving free rein to the mental power of all the service personnel and people and causing events to take place one after another to knock the gate to a thriving nation, translating all the people's ideals into brilliant realities.
					
					 The editorial calls on all the servicepersons and people to work hard to win a greater victory in the on-going drive for a great surge under the Songun leadership of the WPK, bearing deep in mind the immense national honor of holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Denounce Criminal Confab
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Denounce Criminal Confab
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy, the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held a press conference in Seoul on Jan. 28 at which they denounced the south Korean and U.S. bellicose forces for holding a criminal confab aimed at tightening the "alliance" for aggression.
					 The speakers at the conference referred to the fact that the bellicose forces held the 24th meeting on the south Korea-U.S. "security policy initiative" at which they hatched war plots as evidenced by the adoption of "defence guidelines" that comprehensively deal with military counter-actions and cooperation system in the event of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 This is intended to meet the U.S. interests and carry out its military strategy and step up the preparations for a preemptive attack on the north, they held.
					
					 They urged the authorities to stop at once the moves to tighten the "alliance" as they are designed to escalate the military tension and confrontation.

articles.title: Koreans in US Vow to Move for National Reunification
articles.content:
Koreans in US Vow to Move for National Reunification 
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. held the 14th general meeting on Jan. 23 calling for a more vigorous movement for national reunification this year.
					 A resolution read out at the general meeting referred to the fact that last year the Koreans struggled for independent reunification, peace and prosperity under the uplifted banner of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The resolution noted that all the Koreans in the U.S. would get united to turn out in a vigorous struggle for the reunification of the divided country this year marking the 10th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 It noted that they would wage a movement for pressurizing the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK and conclude a peace treaty throughout the U.S. in solidarity with various organizations of Koreans in the U.S. and the U.S. organizations for peace movement.
					
					 It stressed that the federation would make positive efforts to see the All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration gain in scope and strength and take the lead in the struggle for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, aware of the duty it assumed before the nation.

articles.title: DPRK FM Statement Hailed in DR Congo
articles.content:
DPRK FM Statement Hailed in DR Congo
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party, the People's Rally for Socialism, the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Working Citizens' Association of the Democratic Republic of Congo and the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association issued a joint statement on Jan. 26 in support of the DPRK Foreign Ministry's statement.
					 The DPRK has made every possible effort to terminate a ceasefire state and establish a lasting peace mechanism on the Korean Peninsula over the past years, the joint statement noted, and went on:
					
					 Nevertheless, such sincere efforts bore no fruit owing to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK every time.
					
					 The process of the six-party talks, which ended in repeated frustration and failure, goes to prove that any problem can never be solved without building of confidence between parties concerned.
					
					 We recognize that the conclusion of a peace treaty is an urgent task to terminate the hostile relations and build confidence between the DPRK and the U.S. and this will be helpful to advancing the process of denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We demand that the U.S. immediately accept the proposal of the DPRK and come out to the talks for replacing the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty.
					
					 We urge the south Korean authorities to respect the June 15 joint declaration and drop their wrong attitude towards the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 We call upon the peace-loving people of the world to fully support the Korean people's just struggle for durable peace on the peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Russia and India
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Russia and India
						
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A film show took place in Russia and a meeting, a lecture, a book exhibition and a film show in India from Jan. 15 to 23 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 On display in the venues were President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century" and books on the revolutionary feats of Kim Jong Il and the advantages of the Korean socialist system.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were "Army of Korea" and "Party Founding Memorial Tower" and other Korean films.
					
					 The general director of a Russian company said after the film show that the recent world-startling miracles wrought by the Korean people would have been unthinkable without the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The secretary general of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung said in the lecture that the Korean people, who regard it as their highest national pride and honor to have Kim Jong Il, are praising him as the person possessed of the spirit and wisdom of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 He stressed that the Korean people would open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation without fail in 2012, the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung as they are led by Kim Jong Il, the illustrious commander of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Finland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Finland
						
Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A Finnish preparatory committee for celebrating February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, was formed with due ceremony in Helsinki on Jan. 25.
					 Juha Kieksy, chairman of the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the ceremony.
					
					 The preparatory committee set the days up to Feb. 18 as a celebration period and decided to hold colorful political and cultural events, including a seminar on works of Kim Jong Il and a meeting, in the period.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- On January 27, Juche 61 (1972) General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to "Yangsando", a dance created by the Mansudae Art Troupe. 
					 After watching the dance performed with parasol, pronounced yangsan in Korean, as property he said "Yangsando" was a folk song of Korea with nothing to do with parasol.
					
					 With the choreographer feeling ashamed of himself, Kim Jong Il told him that it would be better to replace parasol with janggo (hourglass drum).
					
					 Inspired by his suggestion, the choreographer said with conviction that he would renew the dance with janggo.
					
					 Later, "Yangsando" was recreated as a janggo dance of the Korean style, one of the models in the Juche-oriented dancing art, winning popularity among audience.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Nong Duc Manh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Nong Duc Manh
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 2 un mensaje de felicitacion a Nong Duc Manh, Secretario General del CC del Partido Comunista de Vietnam (PCV), en ocasion del 80o aniversario de la fundacion de esta entidad politica.
					  La misiva senala como sigue: 
					
					  Con motivo del 80o aniversario de la fundacion del PCV, envio mis calidas felicitaciones a usted y, por su conducto, al CC del PCV, todos sus militantes y el pueblo vietnamita.
					
					  La fundacion del PCV fue evento historico que trajo un cambio radical en la forja del destino del pueblo vietnamita.
					
					  Superando toda clase de pruebas y dificultades durante largo tiempo, el PCV organizo y dirigio a la victoria la lucha del pueblo vietnamita por lograr la independencia nacional y la reunificacion del pais y construir el socialismo.
					
					  Estamos complacidos de los grandes exitos que bajo la direccion del PCV, que tiene a usted como Secretario General, el pueblo vietnamita alcanza en su lucha por construir un Vietnam poderoso y prospero en acato al legado del Presidente Ho Chi Minh.
					
					  Nuestro encuentro en 2007 marco un importante hito para el impulso dinamico del desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los dos partidos y dos paises.
					
					  Convencido de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran aun mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos partidos y dos pueblos, deseo de todo corazon a vuestro partido mayores exitos en la lucha por el triunfo de la causa socialista.

articles.title: Tiene lugar contacto de expertos Norte-Sur sobre la ZIK
articles.content:
Tiene lugar contacto de expertos Norte-Sur sobre la ZIK
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia primero en el terreno el contacto de los expertos entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea sobre la Zona Industrial de Kaesong (ZIK).
					En la ocasion, nuestra parte propuso debatir primero el problema de aumento de salario de nuestros trabajadores y de arriendo de la tierra.
					
					Al dar espaldas a nuestra justa propuesta de principios, la parte surcoreana insistio por una parte en la "solucion preferencial del problema del 'trafico, la admision de la aduana y las comunicaciones'" y por la otra, obstaculizo intencionalmente el debate del problema cuestionando el rutinario ejercicio militar del Ejercito Popular de Corea con unos terminos como la supuesta "creacion de tension" y la "inseguridad" de alguien.
					
					Nuestra parte fustigo categoricamente a la parte Sur que lleva las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas a la fase de confrontacion librando la campana conflictiva con la RPDC bajo el pretexto del ejercicio de artilleria del EPC.
					
					Enfatizo que la parte surena debe aceptar lo mas pronto posible las conversaciones de expertos militares planteadas por nuestra parte si tiene de veras la voluntad de solucionar el problema del "trafico, la admision de la aduana y las comunicaciones" de la ZIK y asumir correcta posicion sobre el aumento de salario.
					
					Sobre todo, puso en claro que el aumento inmediato del salario de nuestros trabajadores constituye un problema clave y apremiante que esta relacionado tanto con las actuales labores de la ZIK como con sus perspectivas.
					
					Al cuestionar la charlataneria en que incurrio la parte Sur insistiendo porfiadamente en los problemas secundarios que ha presentado en el anterior contacto sin preparacion alguna ni estudio, nuestra parte le exigio que proceda con sinceridad al debate de los problemas realistas presentados por si misma.
					
					Ambas partes acordaron consultar en el proximo contacto el problema de construccion del albergue de los trabajadores y de aumento de su salario y los otros y tratar el problema del "trafico, la admision de la aduana y las comunicaciones" de la ZIK en las conversaciones de expertos militares Norte-Sur.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de personalidad peruana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de personalidad peruana
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del cumpleanos (16 de febrero) del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, le dedico presente Yuri Castro Romero, secretario general del Instituto Cultural y de Amistad Peruano-Coreano.
					  El lo entrego el 29 de enero a un funcionario de la embajada coreana en su pais.

articles.title: Cuadros coreanos se reunen con el embajador chino
articles.content:
Cuadros coreanos se reunen con el embajador chino
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, y el vicepremier Ro Tu Chol departieron juntos el dia 2 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo con el embajador de la Republica Popular China en Corea, Liu Xiaoming, quien les hizo una visita de despedida.
					El mismo dia, lo hizo tambien el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Yang Hyong Sop, en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae.

articles.title: Firma de convenio de paz es la tarea acuciante para desnuclearizacion
articles.content:
Firma de convenio de paz es la tarea acuciante para desnuclearizacion
						
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ATCC) -- En un comentario individual difundido este martes, el diario Rodong Sinmun advirtio que las consecuencias catastroficas, que emanaran de la eventual guerra nueva en la Peninsula Coreana, seran incomparables con las que trajo la guerra coreana desatada en el siglo pasado.
					  El remedio mas realista para prevenir esa contingencia tan critica es cancelar cuanto antes el caduco Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea y concertar el convenio de paz con el fin de establecer el sistema de paz duradera en la Peninsula Coreana, comienza el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					  Cuando el Acuerdo de Armisticio fuera sustituido por el otro de paz, se eliminara la confrontacion militar en la Peninsula Coreana, se resolvera por si solo el problema de aseguramiento de la confianza entre la RPDC y EE.UU. y, a la larga, se creara el ambiente pacifico en la region de Asia-Pacifico. 
					
					  Dado que EE.UU. reitero en varias ocasiones que "no tiene la voluntad de invadir" a la RPDC y expreso la voluntad de establecer el sistema de paz en la Peninsula Coreana, no tiene motivo que le impida aceptar la propuesta de la RPDC de concertar el convenio de paz. 
					
					  Si EE.UU. toma la verdadera posicion de resolver el problema de la Peninsula Coreana, no le sera un problema la firma del convenio de paz y se promovera rapidamente el proceso de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					  El problema de la firma del convenio de paz se solucionara sin complicaciones cuando EE.UU. vea correctamente la situacion cambiada y la corriente del desarrollo de la historia y cambie valientemente su politica sobre Corea conforme a sus intereses nacionales y a la aspiracion de los pueblos del mundo amantes de la paz. 
					
					  La firma del convenio de paz no es un problema segun el cual una parte beneficia o paga a la contraparte, sino un asunto politico pragmatico que resulta beneficioso tanto para la RPDC, EE.UU. y otros paises interesados como para la sociedad internacional y contribuye a la preservacion de la paz mundial. 
					
					EE.UU. debe aceptar con sinceridad la propuesta de la RPDC y seguir la opinion publica mundial, en lugar de estar sonando con alguna vanidad.
